text:
If the number of points of any player changes at any time they, must announce their new total
followed by the change in parenthesis in the Telegram points thread. If anyone’s total is not
correct anyone else may correct it.
26.author: Initial

notes.content: Ruled not a valid rule-change. See Points of Order 9.2 and 9.3.
notes.author: Ben

notes.content: Votes for: Dave M, Alex T, Ben P. Votes against: Chris B.
notes.author: Ben

text: Amend Rule 205 by replacing all text with "With the exception of Rule 201, and then only for the sole purpose of allocating days, no player may be referred to by name in an rule. More generally, rules may not individually specify players using anything other than in-game characteristics (subject to the above exemption). Days of the week may not be used to specify players."
40.author: Alex T

notes.content: Votes for: Alex T, Alex W. Votes against: Chris B, Dave M.
notes.author: Ben

text: Enact the following new rule: "Players may trade points amongst themselves. To give points to another player, the donor submits a message in the Telegram points thread stating their intention to transfer points, specifying the player(s) to receive points and the amounts. The points are then immediately transferred and the new points totals announced. Players may only trade and recieve a positive integer number of points. If any transfer would result in the donor having a negative number of points, the message is considered entirely void. Transfers messages which are conditional in any way are void. Promises of future transfers by informal means are not enforceable. The interpretation of messages within the Telegram points thread are subject to Judgements in the sense of Rule 214. If any Judgement requires an adjustment of the most recent points totals, the Judge does so after Judgement has been invoked.
48.author: Alex T

text: The winner is the first player to achieve 200 (positive) points.
27.author: Initial

text: An adopted rule-change takes full effect at the moment of the completion of the vote that adopted it. This is subject to Rule 214 .
23.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Ben P, Dave M, Alex W, Chris B, Alex T.
notes.author: Ben

text: Rule 204 is amended as follows: delete everything in Rule 204 after "if and only if" and replace with: "a simple majority of the votes cast by the time of completion of the vote are in favour of the rule-change; unless the rule-change transmutes an immutable rule into a mutable rule, in which case the vote must be unanimous among the votes cast by the time of completion of the vote. Transmutation shall not be implied, but must be stated explicitly in a proposal to take effect."
34.author: Dave M

notes.content: Votes for: Chris B, Alex W, Ben P, Dave M. Votes against: Alex T.
notes.author: Ben

text: Rule 112 is transmuted into a mutable rule.
37.author: Chris B

text:
Rule-changes that affect rules needed to allow or apply rule-changes are as permissible as other
rule-changes. Even rule-changes that amend or repeal their own authority are permissible. No rule-change or type of move is impermissible solely on account of the self-reference or self-application
of a rule.
16.author: Initial

text:
A rule-change is adopted if and only if the vote is unanimous among the votes cast at the completion
of the vote. If this rule is not amended by the end of the second complete circuit of turns, it
automatically changes to require only a simple majority of the votes cast at the completion of the
vote.
21.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Chris B, Ben P. Votes against: Alex W, Dave M.
notes.author: Ben

text: (Proposition 303) That the following be enacted as a new rule. An accusation is made by writing in the voting thread "Accuse:" followed by the name of one player, and precise descriptions of any number of trangressions of the rules during the current day by the named player. Any player may make an accusation at any time on any day allocated to a player as per rule 201. On each day when accusations may be made, a Penalty Setter shall be designated for each accusation made. This shall be the player who precedes the Judge for new points of order as per rule 214, except in cases where that player is accused. The Judge becomes the Penalty Setter in cases where the Penalty Setter would otherwise be the accused. The Penalty Setter for an accusation may, until the end of the day, set the penalty by writing a number of points in the voting thread preceded by "Set penalty:", with a reference to the accusation. The penalty thus indicated must be one (but may be any) of those explicitly stated in one of the rules allegedly transgressed or 20 points if this is less. The penalty must be non-negative and can be at most 20 points. The stated penalty for transgressing a rule (or part thereof) whose transgression automatically changes the transgressor's points total is considered to be zero for the purposes of this rule. For one hour subsequent to the penalty being set, each player other than the accused may once write either "Impose" or "Not impose" into the voting thread, with reference to the set penalty. Unless at least one player writes "Not impose", and as soon as this is determined, the penalty is imposed. If the penalty setter is the accuser, at least one other player must write "Impose" for the penalty to be imposed. When a penalty is imposed, the accused player's points total immediately decreases by the amount indicated when the penalty was set. Instead of setting a penalty, the Penalty Setter may write "Dismiss" in the voting thread with reference to an accusation if, in their opinion, one of the following is true: none of the alleged transgressions carries a substantive points penalty; the accusation is unclear, speculative, or spurious; the accusation pertains to a different day; or that at least one of the alleged transgressions has been the subject of a previous accusation. A brief reason for the dismissal may be appended to this message. Upon the dismissal of an accusation the points total of the accuser immediately decreases by 5 points. There is a penalty of 10 points for dismissing an accusation except for the reasons outlined above. A player may not make more than two accusations per day; there is a penalty of 10 points per accusation made after the second. The general penalty for intentional non-compliance with this rule, or the misuse of the associated terminology in the voting thread is 5 points.
35.author: Ben P

text:
If the legality of a move cannot be determined with finality, or if by the Judge’s best reasoning, not
overruled, a move appears equally legal and illegal, then the player whose move is in question is
the winner. If the rules are changed so that further play is impossible, the player who’s allocated
day it is the winner.
This rule takes precedence over every other rule determining the winner.
32.author: Initial

notes.content: Pending decision on how Chris B voted.
notes.author: Ben

notes.content: Votes for: Dave M, Ben P.
notes.author: Ben

text: (a) Amend Rule 214 as follows: 1. Replace "The player whose allocated day preceded the current day is to be the Judge and decide the question." with "For each Point of Order, a List of Judges shall be drawn up, starting from the player whose allocated day preceded the current day, and proceeding through the players in reverse playing order, excluding the player who invoked the Point of Order, and the player whose allocated day it is under Rule 201. The player at the top of the List of Judges shall be the Judge and decide the question." 2. Replace "If a Judge’s Judgment is overruled, then the player preceding the Judge in the order of Rule 201 becomes the new Judge for the Point of Order, and so on, except that no player is to be Judge during his or her own turn or during the turn of a team-mate." with "If a Judge’s Judgment is overruled, then the player next in the List of Judges for that Point of Order shall become the new Judge for that Point of Order." 3. Replace "Unless a Judge is overruled, one Judge settles all questions arising from the game until the next turn is begun, including questions as to his or her own legitimacy and jurisdiction as Judge." with "A Judge is empowered to settle any question arising from the game, including questions as to their own legitimacy and jurisdiction as Judge." 4. Replace "If the Judge has not invoked Judgement by the end of the day, they forfeit their position as Judge on that Point of Order to the player preceding them in the order of days, excluding the player who’s allocated day it is or one of their teammates" with "If the Judge has not invoked Judgement by the end of the day, they forfeit their position as Judge on that Point of Order to the player next in the List of Judges for that Point of Order." 5. At end, add a new paragraph: "If, at any time, the end of the List of Judges is reached and no player is eligible to be selected as Judge, the player whose allocated day it is under Rule 201 shall post "Judgement: Void" in the Telegram voting thread, referring to the Point of Order in question, and the Point of Order shall stand unresolved. Nothing in this paragraph shall prejudice any player from raising the same Point of Order again." (b) Enact the following as a new rule: "1. At any time, any player may nominate a Proxy by typing "Proxy:" and the name of another player in the Telegram voting thread. 2. The named player shall, within one calendar day of being nominated, indicate their acceptance or rejection of Proxy status by typing "Proxy accepted" or "Proxy rejected" in the Telegram voting thread, referencing the original message. If the nominated player fails to respond within one calendar day either accepting or rejecting the Proxy, the Proxy nomination shall be automatically rejected. 3. A player who has validly nominated a Proxy under paragraph 1, and whose nominated Proxy has accepted the Proxy under paragraph 2, shall be deemed to have an Active Proxy. 4. When a player with an Active Proxy wishes to resume control, the player shall type "Proxy revoked" in the Telegram voting thread, and the player shall be deemed to no longer have an Active Proxy. 5. When a player who has accepted a Proxy wishes to end that Proxy, the player shall type in the Telegram voting thread "Proxy ended for" and the name of the player for whom they wish to cease being Proxy. Upon ending the Proxy, the player who nominated the Proxy shall be deemed to no longer have an Active Proxy. 6. When nominating a Proxy, the player may specify when the Proxy will end. At the specified end time, control shall return to the player as if they had typed "Proxy revoked" in the Telegram voting thread. If a date is specified without a time, the end date shall be construed as the end of the named day. If no end date is specified, the Proxy continues until further notice. 7. Specifying an end date does not preclude a player from revoking or ending an Active Proxy in accordance with paragraph 4 and 5 at any time earlier than the designated end date. 8. Any messages in the Telegram voting thread sent by a player with an Active Proxy are considered void, except for any message of the form "Proxy revoked". 9. While acting as Proxy, the named player shall be entitled to one additional vote for each Proxy they exercise. When voting on another player's behalf, the Proxy must type "Proxy vote for" followed by the name of the player on behalf of whom they are making the vote, followed by "Yes" or "No". That vote shall be counted as if it were a vote by the person on behalf of whom the Proxy is voting. This takes precedence over Rule 208. 10. Messages in the Telegram voting thread nominating, revoking, accepting, rejecting, or ending a Proxy, sent in accordance with this rule, are exempt from all time and day restrictions. In particular, such messages may be posted at any time without being considered void. This takes precedence over Rule 307. 11. No player who is already acting as Proxy for another player may nominate a Proxy for themselves, without first ending the Proxy they have previously accepted. 12. No player who has been nominated as Proxy for another player may nominate a Proxy for themselves, without first rejecting the original nomination. 13. No player may be nominated as a Proxy if they have already nominated a Proxy for themselves. 14. No player may act as Proxy for more than one other player at any given time. 15. A nomination of a Proxy which contravenes paragraphs 11-14 shall not apply, and any such nomination or acceptance shall constitute a void message. 16. If, at any time under Rule 214, a player who has an Active Proxy is called to be Judge, then the Proxy shall become the Judge for that Point of Order, unless the Proxy is either the player who invoked the Point of Order, or the player whose allocated day it is under Rule 201, in which case the player next in the List of Judges for that Point of Order shall become the Judge for that Point of Order."
51.author: Dave M

notes.content: Votes for: Alex T, Alex W. Votes against: Chris B, Ben P, Dave M.
notes.author: Ben

text: In Rule 202, make the following changes — replace “7pm” by “8pm”, — add to the end of the first paragraph “if the message is not void and all of the above are satisfied, then the submission is considered proper.” — add a second paragraph: “The game is considered active only on days which are allocated and only between 7am-9am and after 6pm. All messages in the voting thread outside these times are considered void, including those of the form specified in Rule 214. All references to a time length in hours and/or minutes implicitly refer to that length of active game time.” — add a third paragraph: “This rule does not regulate messages within the points thread, discussion thread or privately between individuals.''
36.author: Alex T

text:
A rule-change is proposed by submitting it in text form preceded by the words “Rule-change:” to
the Telegram voting thread, after which it may not be modified or withdrawn.
The proposer decides the form of the proposal is to be voted on. If they are adopted, they shall
guide play in the form in which they were voted on.
6.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Ben P, Alex W, Alex T.
notes.author: Ben

text: That the following amendments be made to Rule 314. Add a fifth paragraph: "If the text of a proposed rule change is too long for one Telegram message, it may be submitted in several parts, each posted in a separate message. All but the final part of a proposal shall state explicitly that the proposal is continued in the next message. The first part of a proposal that does not contain such a statement shall be considered the final part." Then add a sixth paragraph: "A proposal may only be considered properly submitted once the final part is posted. After the first part of a proposal is posted in the Voting Thread, the proposer may only post there to continue the proposal text; this restriction only applies before the final part is posted, and only until the end of the day."
52.author: Ben P

text:
No rule-change may take effect earlier than the moment of the completion of the vote that adopted
it, even if its wording explicitly states otherwise. No rule-change may have retroactive application.
7.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Dave M, Alex T, Ben P, Alex W.
notes.author: Ben

text:
Rule 312 is amended as follows. Add the following two paragraphs at the beginning:
"A rule-alteration is any one of the following:
(a) the enactment of a new mutable rule;
(b) the repeal of a mutable rule;
(c) the amendment of a mutable rule; or
(d) the repeal of the amendment of a mutable rule that was made most recently, among the amendments currently in effect for that rule. When an amendment is repealed by a rule-alteration of type (d), the amended rule is restored to the version that was in effect immediately prior to the repealed amendment being made." Replace all text after "A rule-change is " by
"one of the following:
(1) the transmutation of one or more rules from mutable to immutable;
(2) the transmutation of one or more rules from immutable to mutable; or
(3) one or more rule-alterations of any type and in any combination." Add a fourth paragraph:
"When a proposed rule-change specifies more than one transmutation or rule-alteration, each specification shall begin in a new numbered paragraph and be completed before the next specification begins. If the proposal is accepted, the specified transmutations or rule-alterations shall take effect in the order in which they are specified. In particular, references to rules by number shall be interpreted after any re-numbering due to previous rule-alterations or transmutations being effected."
47.author: Ben P

text:
Each player is allocated one day a week. These days are

Chris B Monday
Dave M Tuesday
Ben P Wednesday
Alex T Thursday
Alex W Friday
Any message posted in the voting thread on a Saturday or Sunday is to be considered void. All players begin with zero points.
18.author: Initial

text:
All rule-changes proposed in the proper way shall be voted on. They will be adopted if and only if
they receive the required number of votes.
3.author: Initial

text:
If two or more mutable rules conflict with one another, or if two or more immutable rules conflict
with one another, then the rule with the lowest ordinal number takes precedence.
If at least one of the rules in conflict explicitly says of itself that it defers to another rule (or type of
rule) or takes precedence over another rule (or type of rule), then such provisions shall supersede
the numerical method for determining precedence.
If two or more rules claim to take precedence over one another or to defer to one another, then
the numerical method again governs.
30.author: Initial

text:
There must always be at least one mutable rule. The adoption of rule-changes must never become
completely impermissible.
15.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Dave M, Alex T, Alex W, Chris B, Ben P.
notes.author: Ben

text: Rule 309 is amended as follows: At the start of the first paragraph, insert "1." At the start of the second paragraph, insert "2. If a rule is enacted, it receives the number of the proposal to enact it." Add a third paragraph: "3. When paragraph 2 would cause the number of a single proposal to be given to multiple rules, these rules shall instead be given consecutive numbers, starting with the number of the proposal. The affected rules shall be given these numbers in the order in which the proposal would first cause paragraph 2 to be invoked for each rule. If such a proposal is enacted, the following proposal shall be given the number succeeding the highest number assigned to a rule due to the enactment, rather than the number specified in paragraph 1."
46.author: Dave M

text:
Rule-changes that transmute immutable rules into mutable rules may be adopted if and only if
the vote is unanimous among the eligible voters. Transmutation shall not be implied, but must be
stated explicitly in a proposal to take effect.
10.author: Initial

text: If players disagree about the legality of a move or the interpretation or application of a rule, then any player may call for a Judgement on the decision. They do so by entering a message into the Telegram voting thread of the form “Point of Order:” followed by a description of the statement to be judged. The player whose allocated day preceded the current day is to be the Judge and decide the question. After considering the statement, they pronounce their verdict by typing “Judgement:” followed by their decision into the Telegram voting chat. This must reference the original Point of Order. Following the pronouncement, there is a one hour period in which any of the other players may dispute the decision. They do this by typing “Dispute:” followed by a reference to the Judgement into the voting thread. Players other than the Judge then have one hour to each type either “I agree with Judgement...” or “I disagree with Judgement...” followed by a reference to the Judgement. If no one disputes the decision within an hour or a single player other than the Judge agrees then the decision comes into effect. This process is called invoking Judgment. Otherwise, i.e. a player disputed the Judgement and all the other players who expressed an opinion within one hour from the dispute unanimously disagreed with the Judge’s decision, the Judge is overruled. If a Judge’s Judgment is overruled, then the player preceding the Judge in the order of Rule 201 becomes the new Judge for the Point of Order, and so on, except that no player is to be Judge during his or her own turn or during the turn of a team-mate. Unless a Judge is overruled, one Judge settles all questions arising from the game until the next turn is begun, including questions as to his or her own legitimacy and jurisdiction as Judge. If the Judge has not invoked Judgement by the end of the day, they forfeit their position as Judge on that Point of Order to the player preceding them in the order of days, excluding the player who’s allocated day it is or one of their teammates. The same applies for the new Judge. Any proposed rule-change involved in a dispute is voted on in the usual fashion, but if approved whilst still awaiting Judgement, the rule is not taken into effect until all the related Judgements are invoked. This has precedence over Rule 206 . All other actions under dispute are delayed until all relevant Judgements are invoked. A point of order may not be raised against a proposed rule-change for which voting has been completed but the rule-change has not yet come into effect. Multiple Points of Order may be brought up simultaneously. No player may have more than three active points of order at any one time. New Judges are not bound by the decisions of old Judges. New Judges may, however, settle only those questions on which the players currently disagree and that affect the completion of the turn in which Judgment was invoked. All decisions by Judges shall be in accordance with all the rules then in effect; but when the rules are silent, inconsistent, or unclear on the point at issue, then the Judge shall consider game-custom and the spirit of the game before applying other standards.
31.author: Initial

text:
Whatever is not prohibited or regulated by a rule is permitted and unregulated, with the sole
exception of changing the rules, which is permitted only when a rule or set of rules explicitly or
implicitly permits it.
17.author: Initial

text: When a proposed rule-change is defeated, the player who proposed it loses 10 points.
24.author: Initial

text: Every player is an eligible voter.
4.author: Initial

text: All times specified in rules in UK time. Days are considered to start and end in UK time.
5.author: Initial

text:
A rule-change is any of the following: (1) the enactment, repeal, or amendment of a mutable
rule; (2) the enactment, repeal, or amendment of an amendment of a mutable rule; or (3) the
transmutation of an immutable rule into a mutable rule or vice versa.
2.author: Initial

text: Each player always has exactly one vote.
25.author: Initial

text:
Each proposed rule-change shall be given a number for reference. The numbers shall begin with
301, and each rule-change proposed in the proper way shall receive the next successive integer,
whether or not the proposal is adopted.
If a rule is repealed and reenacted, it receives the number of the proposal to reenact it. If a rule
is amended or transmuted, it receives the number of the proposal to amend or transmute it. If an
amendment is amended or repealed, the entire rule of which it is a part receives the number of the
proposal to amend or repeal the amendment.
8.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Chris B, Alex T, Alex W. Votes against: Dave M, Ben P.
notes.author: Ben

text: Enact the following new rule: "Players may trade points amongst themselves. To give points to another player, the donor submits a message in the Telegram points thread stating their intention to transfer points, specifying the player(s) to receive points and the amounts. The points are then immediately transferred and the new points totals announced. Players may only trade and receive a positive integer number of points. If any transfer would result in the donor having a negative number of points, the message is considered entirely void. Transfers messages which are conditional in any way are void. Promises of future transfers by informal means are not enforceable. The interpretation of messages within the Telegram points thread are subject to Judgements in the sense of Rule 214. If any Judgement requires an adjustment of the most recent points totals, the Judge does so after Judgement has been invoked."
50.author: Chris B

text:
Initially rules in the 100’s are immutable and rules in the 200’s are mutable. Rules subsequently
enacted or transmuted (that is, changed from immutable to mutable or vice versa) may be im-mutable or mutable regardless of their numbers, and rules in the Initial Set may be transmuted
regardless of their numbers.
1.author: Initial

text:
All players must always abide by all the rules then in effect, in the form in which they are then in
effect. The rules in the Initial Set are in effect whenever a game begins. The Initial Set consists of
Rules 101-118 (immutable) and 201-215 (mutable).
0.author: Initial

text:
After completion of the vote the proposer adds the following number of points to their total

(max{ 10, number of the highest numbered existing rule-290})×number of “Vote: Yes” votes total number of votes cast.
20.author: Initial

text: Players may only propose rule-changes on their allocated day. The rule-change must be submitted in the sense of Rule 107 before 7pm on their allocated day to be considered proper. Only the first rule change submitted on a given day is considered proper.
19.author: Initial

text:
Immediately after a proposal is submitted in the proper fashion, players may cast their vote(s)
within the Telegram voting thread. A vote is cast by replying with either the message “Vote: Yes”
or “Vote: No” to support or disagree with the proposal. A vote may not be withdrawn. Any
messages sent after the player has already used their vote(s) are not counted towards the total.
Voting is completed at the end of the day the proposal was submitted. After this point players may
not vote on the proposal.
12.author: Initial

text:
If and when rule-changes can be adopted without unanimity, the players who vote against winning
proposals shall receive 10 points each.
22.author: Initial

text:
The state of affairs that constitutes winning may not be altered from achieving n points to any other
state of affairs. The magnitude of n and the means of earning points may be changed, and rules
that establish a winner when play cannot continue may be enacted and (while they are mutable)
be amended or repealed.
13.author: Initial

text:
In a conflict between a mutable and an immutable rule, the immutable rule takes precedence and
the mutable rule shall be entirely void. For the purposes of this rule a proposal to transmute an
immutable rule does not "conflict" with that immutable rule.
11.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Chris B, Dave M, Ben P, Alex T.
notes.author: Ben

text: Rule 205 is repealed.
41.author: Chris B

notes.content: Votes for: Alex W, Dave M, Ben P.
notes.author: Ben

text: Transmute 103.
45.author: Alex W

text:
A player always has the option to forfeit the game rather than continue to play or incur a game
penalty. No penalty worse than losing, in the judgment of the player to incur it, may be imposed.
14.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Ben P, Dave M, Chris B, Alex W, Alex T.
notes.author: Ben

text: Transmute Rule 111 to make it a mutable rule.
43.author: Ben P

notes.content: Votes for: Dave M, Chris B. Votes against: Alex W.
notes.author: Ben

text: In order for any vote to pass we require only a simple majority of the votes cast at the completion of the vote. This rule supersedes Rule 111 and Rule 204
33.author: Chris B

notes.content: Votes for: Ben P, Alex T, Dave M. Votes against: Chris B, Alex W.
notes.author: Ben

text: That Rule 202 be amended as follows: — replace "7pm" by "8pm", — add a second paragraph: "A Nomic day comprises the hours 7am-9am and 5:30pm-11pm on a day of the week allocated to a player in the sense of Rule 201. In the rules, the term 'day' shall be understood to mean 'Nomic day' unless specified otherwise. The names of days of the week specify calendar days, rather than Nomic days, unless stated otherwise. All posts in the voting thread outside of a Nomic day are considered void, including those of the form specified in Rule 214." — add a third paragraph: "Any period of time specified in the rules in units of hours and/or minutes, and without reference to times of the clock, shall be considered to exclude time outside of Nomic days, unless stated otherwise. That is, such a period only ends when the specified time has elapsed since the period began, not counting time outside of Nomic days" — add a fourth paragraph: "This rule does not regulate messages within the points thread, discussion thread or privately between individuals."
39.author: Ben P

text: If the number of a rule is changed, due to Rule 109 or otherwise, any reference to that rule number is also changed.
9.author: Initial

text:
Players may discuss any topics with any other player(s) without the knowledge of the remaining
players. The Telegram discussion thread may be used for any purposes, but messages may not be
deleted or edited in any of the voting, points or discussion threads.
29.author: Initial

notes.content: Votes for: Alex T, Dave M, Alex W. Votes against: Chris B, Ben P.
notes.author: Ben

text: Rule 302 is amended as follows: Replace "transmutes an immutable rule into a mutable rule" with "transmutes a rule (either an immutable rule into a mutable rule, or a mutable rule into an immutable rule)".
38.author: Dave M

notes.content: Votes for: Alex T, Alex W, Ben P.
notes.author: Ben

text: Transmute 313.
49.author: Alex W

text: At no time may there be more than 25 mutable rules.
28.author: Initial
